Description: People can see the picture of the study places before they are getting there.
Some people donêt want to study in a loud place.
Berkeley students can know the library is empty or not, to which they want to go
When people arrived at the library, people are angry if the library is full
If people meet as a group, they need a whiteboard in order to share their thoughts easily and together
Some group wants to be separated from other people in order to really focus on their working
Many students woke up early for class, so they need sometimes sleeping area
The weather is sometimes really hot, so people want to go to a study place being really cool
If people can know what the place is empty now, people can save their time for searching study room
Most people need the sockets for their laptop, cellphone, and other electrical devices
People can avoid walking if they know available for the library.
People can know their friends where they are.
The App can find the distance from our position.
People want to study in clean places.
People want to study no weird smell place.
The App can be easily accessed by Berkeley students.
The App should be easy to use for people with simple design.
The people want to get water purifier lots of time, so the water purifier locations are also important.
People can know the food is available in the library.
People can know how to get there with transportation.
In the App, people can know how long time to reach library if App is connected with Google map.
If the App connected with Facebook, people can login easily.
The GUI of App can be simple enough to use quickly access.
If the App has the reward coupon of near CAF€, people can study that places.
The App has a favorite food of the CAF€ restaurant, so people can know the information of the best food.
Study cubicles that students can rent out at certain rates - similar to internet cafes, but for studying
Website that tells students where to study based on their preferences (e.g. quiet areas, loud areas, open areas)
Allows users to find study partners studying the same subject on campus
Portable panels that can be set up to reduce background noises via active noises
Repainting the libraries' walls to make it feel much more lively and comfortable
Change the hours of operation of the libraries/study spaces
Tells students of open classrooms so that they can use it as alternatives to study spaces - either for independent studying or group studying
Study rooms that students can rent out at certain rates
Application that reserves classrooms/conferences for studying
App that lets students know of popular establishments to study at (e.g. Peet's, Starbucks)
Supply snacks to students studying so that they do not starve and also do not have to worry about leaving their seats
Monitors amount of open seats in a library/study space
Monitors the sound of study spaces and displays this information to students so they can use it to decide where they wanna go to study
Supply more furniture to study spaces to increase their appeal
Displays classrooms/study rooms with whiteboard for use
Users can rent power strips to use when studying, if they are too far from outlets or there are too many people
Supplies users with ear buds and noise canceling headphones if they are studying in loud areas
Recommends locations to study during the weekend (when most classrooms and libraries are closed)
Lets users know which study rooms have the best natural lights
Supplies the essential fluid of studying to users who can't be bothered to leave their seat
Students can send files they need to print, and it gets delivered to them so they can study without leaving
App that disables social media on phones to prevent students from getting distracted
Supplies students with the necessary study materials, so students can pick it up and use it for studying, don't have to go out of their way to buy it, similar to Amazon@ASUC pickups
App that tells students the closest open study areas near them
Supplies supplements to students who are studying and not getting enough nutrients (e.g. Fish Oil, Vitamin B12)
Users can see the list of buildings and empty rooms they can use.
People prefer easy looking GUI. Map based GUI might help users to access to information easily
If user clicks a building, user can see the floor plans of that building. Empty rooms can be displayed.
Restroom locations can be included in floor plan.
A user can search empty classrooms by time and date
A user can search empty classrooms by building name so that he/she can choose the building they prefer
The maximum number for classrooms can be shown in GUI
People want to eat with their friends which is not allowed in libraries. We can show if food is allowed in a classroom.
Many groups or clubs want to use a projector. It might be better to show if its available.
Some students feel constrained in non-circulated small libraries.
Users have different emotional connections with different study spots. Icons will help users to choose right place to study
A user can put the purpose of that study spots. They can invite others to join.
Using the floor plan and study spot information, Users can find their classroom easily.
The great places like Hesse hall can be introduced using campus map
Users can choose their needs, preferences, or amenities to find right place easily.
If possible, mobile version is required. PC version might have too broad information which cannot be visible in smartphones.
Some of the class information might be wrong. Getting report from users might help to improve the project
if there is a group meeting for some specific cousrse study meetings, users can be notification
Water fountain location can be shown in GUI
Show the operation hours in GUI
users can delivers to check the exact location for delivery
Show the size or type of whiteboard in each class
Printer and scanner locations can be shown in GUI
People can avoid cleaning time
Location of bus stops help students to choose closer building
The app will show the study spot nearest to all members in the group.
The app will filter room availability based on the hours you study.
The app can link you with other students studying the same material.
You can check the availability of a specific location.
You can reserve a room for the hours you need to study.
The app can filter available rooms depending on resources needed.
The application will allow the user to select the type of study environment
The application will share GSI and professor availability and location.
This feature will allow the creation of study events - study networking.
This feature allows the room experience to be rated and shared with others
This feature will allow the user to see the room capacity.
This feature will reward the user for responsible use of school resources.
Document the time spent at each study session to manage study habits.
Shows the location of resources such as printers, computers, restrooms, and water fountains.
Have campus food delivered to your room.
Get "credit" for how often you study. The more credit, the better opportunities for research and GSI positions.
An icon that shows the type of environment you would be studying at.
Disable social media on your phone to gain reward points.
Set Alarms to warn you when you should be studying.
Create a planner that shows upcoming events.
People who study in quiet environments can share rooms.
Meet with people in clubs to gain an insight on what they do and how much time commitment is needed.
Form groups or search for group members in different classes.
Create a forum to gain student signatures to petition for library and class improvements / renovations.
Rate your study partners to create a system of credibility and comfort.
